verb.description: Get rid of by throwing away or giving or selling to someone else.
examples: people now have substantial assets to dispose of after their death
whose responsibility is it to dispose of scrap materials?

verb.description: Bring (someone) into a particular frame of mind.
examples: prolactin is released, disposing you toward sleep
personalities that dispose them to be uncooperative and egotistic
the chief disposed his attendants in a circle

origin: Late Middle English: from Old French disposer, from Latin disponere arrange, influenced by dispositus arranged and Old French poser to place.
